Package ohos.net

Class LocalSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.net.LocalSocket

  • public class LocalSocket
extends Object
    Represents an AF_LOCAL (also known as AF_UNIX) socket in the UNIX domain namespace.
    Since:
    4

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LocalSocket​(String name, boolean isServer)
      A parameterized constructor used to create a LocalSocket instance.

      Closes the output stream of this socket.

      Closes the socket after the server and client finish communicating with each other.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalSocket

        public LocalSocket​(String name,
                   boolean isServer)
            throws IOException
        A parameterized constructor used to create a LocalSocket instance.

        Currently, only a stream socket can be created. If a server socket is to be created, bind and listen operations will be performed during the creation.

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the socket name. It cannot be null.
        isServer - Specifies whether to create a server or client socket. The value true means to create a server socket, and false means to create a client socket.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if name is null.
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the server socket creation.
        Since:
        4

    • Method Detail

      • connectSocket

        public void connectSocket​()
                   throws IOException
        Connects the client socket to a specified address for setting up a connection with the server.

        The address is the name passed in the constructor.

        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the socket connection status is invalid (for example, already connected) or an error occurs during the socket creation.
        Since:
        4

      • acceptSocket

        public LocalSocket acceptSocket​()
                         throws IOException
        Accepts a connection request from the client.
        Returns:
        Returns a new LocalSocket object for communicating with the client.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation, for example, the socket fails to create.
        Since:
        4

      • closeSocket

        public void closeSocket​()
                 throws IOException
        Closes the socket after the server and client finish communicating with each other.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the socket fails to close.
        Since:
        4

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream​()
                           throws IOException
        Obtains the input stream of this socket.
        Returns:
        Returns the input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation or the socket has been closed.
        Since:
        4

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream​()
                             throws IOException
        Obtains the output stream of this socket.
        Returns:
        Returns the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation or the socket has been closed.
        Since:
        4

      • closeInputStream

        public void closeInputStream​()
                      throws IOException
        Closes the input stream of this socket.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation, for example, the socket fails to create.
        Since:
        4

      • closeOutputStream

        public void closeOutputStream​()
                       throws IOException
        Closes the output stream of this socket.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation, for example, the socket fails to create.
        Since:
        4

      • getSocketFd

        public FileDescriptor getSocketFd​()
        Obtains the file descriptor of this socket.
        Returns:
        Returns the file descriptor if obtained; returns null if no socket is available or the socket has been closed.
        Since:
        4

      • getSocketName

        public String getSocketName​()
        Obtains the socket name.
        Returns:
        Returns the socket name.
        Since:
        4

      • getPeerSocketInfo

        public SocketCertificates getPeerSocketInfo​()
                                     throws IOException
        Obtains certificates of the peer socket.
        Returns:
        Returns certificates of the peer socket, including the PID, UID, and GID of the peer process.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation, for example, the socket fails to create.
        Since:
        4

      • isSocketConnected

        public boolean isSocketConnected​()
        Checks whether this socket is connected.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this socket is connected; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setSocketReadTimeout

        public void setSocketReadTimeout​(int timeout)
                          throws IOException
        Sets the timeout duration for reading data from the input stream of this socket.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Indicates the timeout duration to set, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs during the socket creation, for example, the socket fails to create.
        Since:
        4
